intro: Jungia coarctata subsp. lilacina, commonly known as the lilac-flowered jungle plant, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking lilac-colored flowers and its ability to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Its leaves are typically elliptical and glossy, providing a lush appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
